. It was the site of a major gold rush, claimed the first in the US by local citizens. Gold mining continues to be an important part of cultural identity of Dahlonega and several mines remain open as tourists attractions. It is also home to North Georgia College and State University.

.  Take Hwy. 76 to Ellijay.  From Ellijay continue south on Hwy. 52 to Dahlonega.

, then I-285 by-pass north toward Chattanooga.  Take GA 400 North to the end.  Left onto GA 60 after 5.5 miles GA 60 runs through the Dahlonega square.
Having a car would be best because there are many sites that are spread out, but central Dahlonega, along the downtown square, is navigable by foot.

value: address=185 Consolidated Gold Mine Rd., Dahlonega, GA 30533
price=$11/7 for adults/children. Under 3 get in free

content=At the Consolidated Gold Mine a tour takes you underground into the mine to see what working conditions were like beneath Dahlonega during the gold rush. The tour shows the original cart rails, electrical lines and even an operational pneumatic drill. The tour also include an opportunity to pan for gold.
address=2736 Morrison Moore Parkway East, Dahlonega, GA 30533
content=At Grisson's Gold Mine there is one of the only press mines remaining and gold can be panned here.
content=The Dahlonega Gold Museum is located in the center of the historic square in the old courthouse of Dahlonega.
name=North Georgia College and State University
content=The Military College of Georgia there are many things for a traveler to see. Price Memorial Hall is the gold topped landmark of the campus built on the foundations of the old National Mint.
address=100 North Public Square Dahlonega, Georgia 30533
content=This 4,000 sq ft gallery is located on the top floor of Hall's Block right on the square of downtown Dahlonega.
directions=Turn onto Mechanicsville Rd from Morrison Moore Parkway. Yahoola Creek Park is located at the end of the road.
content=Yahoola Creek Park is home to baseball, softball, and soccer fields. It also has tennis courts. Besides basic park fixtures there is a community garden and 2 miles of hiking/walking trails.

content=festival is held the third weekend in October. Thousands of people fill the town to celebrate the discovery of gold in Dahlonega. Voted one of the Top 20 Events in the southeast by the Southeast Tourism Society.
content=Bear on the Square is a country and folk music festival held each year in mid-April.
content=is a music festival held each year in early November. The festival is held to raise awareness and funds for defending the Hemlock's from attack by the woolly adelgid.
content=The Mountain Flower Art Festival is scheduled for the 3rd week in May on Saturday & Sunday, from 10AM - 5PM.
address=16 Public Square South, Dahlonega, GA 30533-1214
content=Literally a hole in the wall this pizzeria has the best quality pizza for really cheap. A slice of the kitchen sink(ultimate) is only $3.50 and it's huge. The garlic rolls are also amazing.
address=84 South Chestatee Street Dahlonega, GA 30533
content=A traditional shared table, with rich southern food. Excellent quality and a unique experience but comes with a higher price tag.

content=Oldest plantings, newest winery in the Dahlonega area. Covered deck is cool even on hot days, with spectacular views of vinewyards and surrounding mountains. Family friendly. Music and food most weekends during summer.
content=Winery has hilltop views of surrounding vineyards and mountains.
content=Dahlonega's first family farm winery. Property is behind Frogtown Cellars.

For coffee, food, and live music, head over to

value: content=Eco friendly bed and breakfast in the North Georgia mountains and wine country. Adults only. Full vegetarian breakfast each morning, vegan with advance notice.
